DataElement.preferredName: Patient Post Organ Transplantation Or Receive Continue Immunosuppressive Therapy Exclusion Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to whether the patient is post-organ transplantation or receiving ongoing immunosuppressive therapy that excludes a potential subject from participation in a study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Post Organ Transplantation Or Receive Continue Immunosuppressive Therapy Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The transfer of an organ, organ part, or tissue from one body to another, for the purpose of replacing the recipient's damaged or failing organ with a working one from the donor. Donors can be living, or cadaveric (dead)._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._To take, accept, or get something offered._Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption._Therapy used to decrease the body's immune response, such as drugs given to prevent transplant rejection._List of characteristics in a protocol, any one of which may exclude a potential subject from participation in a study. (CDISC glossary)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Post Organ Transplantation Or Receive Continue Immunosuppressive Therapy Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:The transfer of an organ, organ part, or tissue from one body to another, for the purpose of replacing the recipient's damaged or failing organ with a working one from the donor. Donors can be living, or cadaveric (dead).:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:To take, accept, or get something offered.:Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.:deliberate suppression of immune system function for experimental or therapeutic purposes.:Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

The transfer of an organ, organ part, or tissue from one body to another, for the purpose of replacing the recipient's damaged or failing organ with a working one from the donor. Donors can be living, or cadaveric (dead).

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.
deliberate suppression of immune system function for experimental or therapeutic purposes.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/18/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient post-organ tra
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient post-organ transplantation or receiving ongoing immunosuppression treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have post-transplant exposure to donor lymphocyte infusion (DLI), or T-cell or IL-2 targeted medication (e.g. ATG, alemtuzumab, basiliximab, denileukin diftitox) within 100 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have post-transplant exposure to donor lymphocyte infusion (DLI), or T-cell or IL-2 targeted medication (e.g. antithymocyte globulin, alemtuzumab, basiliximab, denileukin diftitox) within 100 days prior to enrollment??

DataElement.changeDescription: 12/3/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review
